translation.en: [man] No live organism can continue to exist sanely
translation.ko: 그 어떤 생명체도 절대적인 현실 속에서는

translation.en: Even larks and katydids are supposed by some to dream.
translation.ko: 종달새와 여치조차 때로는 꿈을 꾸기 마련이다

translation.en: stood by itself against its hills holding darkness within.
translation.ko: 언덕을 등진 채 어둠을 품고 홀로 서 있었다

translation.en: It had stood so for a hundred years before my family moved in...
translation.ko: 우리 가족이 이사 오기 전 100년을 서 있었으며

translation.en: and might stand a hundred more.
Silence lay steadily against the wood and stone of Hill House.
translation.ko: 힐 하우스의 목석 위에는 한결같이 정적이 깔려 있었으며

translation.en: It's okay, Theo. Go back to bed.
Should I wake up Mom and Dad?
I guess we better take a look.
Your big brother must have scared her away.
Big brothers are good like that.
I guess everybody can go back to bed now.
[sighs] You remember what we talked about before?
just like a cup of water can spill sometimes.
translation.ko: 잔에 담긴 물도 가끔 쏟아질 때가 있는데

translation.en: Now, I know that Bent-Neck Lady is really scary.
translation.ko: 목 꺾인 여자가 진짜 무섭긴 하겠지만

translation.en: But that's all she is. She's just a little spill.
How long do we have to live here, Daddy?
translation.ko: 우리 언제까지 여기 살아야 해요, 아빠?

translation.en: your mother and I, we have to finish fixing this house,
translation.ko: 엄마 아빠가 이 집을 마저 수리한 다음

translation.en: and then someone has to buy it.
Yep, and then we can go, just like the last house.
translation.ko: 그래, 그럼 이사 갈 수 있어 전에 살던 그런 집으로

translation.en: Now, you get back to sleep, both of you.
Carl was driving on Rural 86 during the storm.
translation.ko: 칼은 폭풍이 치던 날 86번 도로를 달리고 있었어요

translation.en: Oh, of course not, you were in LA.
And it was a bad one.
It was cats and dogs. The worst I'd seen in ten years.
He was up in the boons when he lost control of the car.
He went over a guardrail and went down a ravine.
The car flipped over, and you couldn't see it from the road,
translation.ko: 차가 뒤집어졌고 길 위에서는 안 보였죠

translation.en: He was hanging there the whole time.
Upside-down, tangled up in his seat belt.
They said he could reach the horn, but...
he couldn't press it for long 'cause, you see, his arm was broken.
translation.ko: 그리 오래 누를 수 없었대요 팔이 부러졌으니까요

translation.en: Upside-down, pressing on that horn for as long as he could stand to.
translation.ko: 거꾸로 매달려 있는 힘껏 경적을 누르다가

translation.en: [voice trembling] The night after he died. It started with drops of water.
translation.ko: 칼이 죽은 다음 날 밤 물방울이 떨어지기 시작했어요

translation.en: I started to hear a car horn.
Distant, I think, but close enough to wake me,
translation.ko: 멀리서 들리는 것 같은데 잠을 깨울 정도였어요

translation.en: Now, this was right after the funeral itself.
This was the night after the burial, you see.
I felt the water... on my cheeks...
and I heard the car horn...
and then, I looked up at the ceiling...
I could-- I could see the water...
a deep purple, like the blood had all just...
It's funny, you'd think you'd scream after seeing something like that,
translation.ko: 이상하죠, 그런 걸 보고 나면 소리를 지를 것 같은데

translation.en: You just stare at it like you're an idiot.
And then, his mouth fell open,
So loud that I fell off the bed.
I screamed because I hit the floor, and it startled me,
and it was like I only just remembered, "Oh, right.
I should probably scream." And I screamed, all right.
And I ran, and I tripped in the hallway,
and I looked back, and he wasn't there, and then I laid there and I cried.
translation.ko: 돌아봤더니 칼은 없었고 저는 거기 누워 엉엉 울었어요

translation.en: And that was the last time I've slept in that room.
translation.ko: 그 방에서 잔 건 그날이 마지막이었죠

translation.en: That's a very interesting story, Mrs. Walker.
This is what I'd like to do. I'd like to look around your house.
I'd like to set up some equipment.
I'd also like to sleep in that room tonight.
I can't promise I'll include your story in my book.
translation.ko: 아이린 이야기를 책에 싣겠단 보장은 못 하지만

translation.en: And I thank you for sharing it with me.
I'm sorry, I should have told you I'm a fan.
That's my favorite, the first one.
"Silence lay steadily against the wood and stone at Hill House,
translation.ko: '힐 하우스의 목석 위에는 한결같이 정적이 깔려 있었으며'

translation.en: and whatever walked there... walked alone."
translation.ko: '그곳에서 걸은 게 무엇이든 그것은 홀로 걸었다'

translation.en: I can't imagine what it was like living there.
translation.ko: 그런 집에서 산다는 게 상상이 안 가네요

translation.en: The most famous haunted house in America.
translation.ko: 미국에서 제일 유명한 유령 들린 집이잖아요

translation.en: it wasn't famous when we moved in.
translation.ko: 저희가 이사 갔을 때는 유명하지 않았어요

translation.en: And besides, you've got me beat.
I mean, if you actually saw your husband hanging upside-down over your bed,
translation.ko: 아이린이 정말 침대 위에 거꾸로 매달린 남편분을 보셨다면

translation.en: you've seen more than I ever have.

translation.ko: 하지만 책에 쓰셨잖아요 알링턴에서도 못 봤고

translation.en: on the Queen Mary or in Williamsburg.
The way you write, I just assumed--
Other people's stories. People like you, Irene.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들 이야기예요 아이린 같은 사람들요

translation.en: I give them the right voice, that's all.
I hope tonight is a game changer for you.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤에 작가님 인생이 바뀌었으면 좋겠네요

translation.en: will finally give you a story of your own.
translation.ko: 작가님 눈으로 직접 보시게 될지도 모르니까요

translation.en: You were one of his favorite writers, so maybe...
that's the reason... for all this.
You know, I-- I can tell you one thing about Hill House
All those years trying to understand what happened in that house,
translation.ko: 그 집에서 일어난 일을 이해하려 몇 년간 애쓰면서

translation.en: you know what I never found?
-How are your brother and sisters, -[phone ringing] I wondered, since the book?
translation.ko: 작가님 동생들은 어때요? 책의 뒷이야기가 궁금했어요

translation.en: How are they doing these days?
You know who I wish would write a book?
-[Young Nell] Just tonight. -[mother] Won't you miss your brother?
translation.ko: 오늘 밤만요 루크 보고 싶지 않을까?

translation.en: -[softly] I'll stay with her a bit. -Okay.
Hey, will you grab her blanket?
Are you saying you'd prefer not to do a viewing?
We want to. It's not that.
translation.ko: 저희는 뵙고 싶죠 그런 얘기가 아니라

translation.en: It's part of your mother's pre-need, so, it's taken care of.
-I think he's just a little, um... -A little nervous about it?
I know this might be a little weird for you,
-but I promise it's all normal. -[receiver clicks]
The reason Mommy and Daddy are here
is because it's important to say goodbye to Grandma.
translation.ko: 할머니께 작별 인사하는 게 중요하기 때문이란다

translation.en: A viewing is just a way to do that, to...
translation.ko: 할머니를 뵙는 건 그 작별 인사일 뿐이야

translation.en: to see her one last time and tell her you love her.
I don't need to say goodbye.
translation.ko: 전 작별 인사 안 해도 돼요

translation.en: A lot of people feel that way at first,
but then they feel much better when they do.
Grammy keeps sitting on my bed at night...
translation.ko: 할머니는 밤마다 제 침대 옆에 앉아서

translation.en: [Nell] It's Nell. Um... I need you to call me.
It's hard to understand, everything's so twisted...
translation.ko: 이해하긴 힘든데 모든 게 너무 뒤틀려서...

translation.en: and it's hard to explain, but...
Hey, I think you really nailed it. It really sends a message.
translation.ko: 당신 이거 참 잘 뽑았어 메시지가 확실하잖아

translation.en: We should put it on the website. I think it'd work great in print, too.
translation.ko: 웹사이트에 올려야겠다 광고를 내도 괜찮을 것 같고

translation.en: If people still read papers, that is.
-[coughs] -[father] This damn flue is a disaster.
-This is supposed to be easy. -[man clears throat]
-There's nothing easy about this house. -[father chuckles]
Just trying to fix a flue. The house doesn't like it, I guess.
translation.ko: 그냥 연통 고치는 건데 이 집은 그게 불만인가 봐

translation.en: -Oh... Mr. Dudley found something for you. -Um.
translation.ko: 더들리 아저씨가 너한테 줄 걸 찾으셨단다

translation.en: I don't know if this is gonna work, young lady.
And I'm gonna need it back.
[Young Shirley] Mr. Dudley says this is a master key,
so, it's supposed to open any door in the house.
[Young Shirley] They've been taking care of this house for years and years,
translation.ko: 아빠 말로는 아저씨랑 아줌마가 이 집을 오랫동안 관리했대

translation.en: so, if anyone would know where the key is...
translation.ko: 그러니까 열쇠 있는 데를 알 만한 사람은...

translation.en: What do you think is in there?
What if it's a cotton candy machine?
[Young Nell] It could be a pony.
I saw the shadow under the door.
This door's been locked for years and years and years and years, so...
translation.ko: 이 문은 아주 오랫동안 잠겨 있었으니까

translation.en: [inhales sharply] ...if there's a pony in there, it's dead.
-Don't say that word. -[Young Nell] You say it.
translation.ko: - 그런 말 쓰지 마 - 언니는 쓰잖아

translation.en: -Can't he just use that big hammer? -[Young Shirley] We'll find the key.
translation.ko: 그냥 아저씨가 커다란 망치로 열면 안 돼? 열쇠 찾아낼 거야

translation.en: I want to see what's in there, too.
Let's go see if Daddy has any more keys.
[Steve] You don't need me to tell you,
but literally everything is an emergency with Nell.
translation.ko: 넬한테는 말 그대로 모든 게 비상사태잖아

translation.en: [Shirley] I know, but she sounded rough.
Rougher than usual. She said it was about Luke.
translation.ko: 평소보다 더 안 좋았다고 루크 일이라고 하더라

translation.en: Well, then he sold his phone for cash
or he's still in rehab, which means we stay out of it.
translation.ko: 아직 중독 치료 시설에 있겠지 얽히지 말잔 소리야

translation.en: Look, I can't deal with this right now. I'm working.
translation.ko: 저기, 난 지금 못 도와줘 일하는 중이라서

translation.en: That's right, Shirl. Something else you want to add?
translation.ko: 그래, 셜 더 할 말 있어?

translation.en: Fine, I'll just handle it, shall I?
That's why everybody dumps their shit on me, isn't it, Steve?
translation.ko: 그러니까 다들 나한테 똥을 떠넘기잖아, 안 그래?

translation.en: 'Cause I'm the oldest. It's my job.
So does this stuff, you know...
[clicks tongue] Don't believe in that word.
Which side of the bed do you sleep on?
I'm talking about the word itself. "Supernatural."
There's natural phenomena that we understand,
translation.ko: 우리가 이해할 수 있는 자연 현상이 있고

translation.en: and then there's natural phenomena that we don't.
translation.ko: 우리가 이해할 수 없는 자연 현상이 있죠

translation.en: Primitive humans used to die of fright during an eclipse.
translation.ko: 원시인들은 일식이나 월식에 놀라서 죽곤 했어요

translation.en: They had no idea what it was.
The eye of an angry God.
Once we understood what it was,
Natural phenomena that we don't quite understand yet.
translation.ko: 우리가 아직 이해하지 못한 자연 현상이란 거죠

translation.en: Uh, no, no message. Just wanted to see if he was there.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 전할 말 없어요 그냥 거기 있나 궁금해서요

translation.en: Uh, what was your name again?
[Nell] Hi, this is Nell. Please leave a message after the beep.
translation.ko: 안녕하세요, 넬입니다 삐 소리가 나면 메시지 남겨주세요

translation.en: It's Steve. I'm sorry I missed your call.
I know you're worried about Luke, but I called his rehab center
translation.ko: 네가 걱정하는 건 아는데 중독 치료 시설에 연락했더니 루크는 잘 있다더라
중독 치료 시설에 연락했더니 루크는 잘 있다더라

translation.en: [chuckles] He actually got his 90-day chip today, if you can believe that.
translation.ko: 오늘 90일 기념 메달 받았대 네가 믿을지 모르겠다만

translation.en: Um, I'll be around tomorrow if you still need to chat.
translation.ko: 그래도 할 얘기 있으면 내일 내가 들를게

translation.en: ♪ But it continues Until I kiss you ♪ ♪ So let's just take it off ♪ ♪ We've waited all night So good, till sunlight ♪
I mean, the program's brutal, but...
translation.ko: 학위 과정이 악랄하긴 한데 보스턴은 마음에 들어요

translation.en: I love Boston, man. It's such a great town.
translation.ko: 학위 과정이 악랄하긴 한데 보스턴은 마음에 들어요 정말 멋진 도시예요

translation.en: I'm just kind of a germophobe.
No. We just did what we came here to do, yeah?
[Theo sighs] I know you normally prefer the company of cold stiffs, but...
translation.ko: 언니가 평소에 시체랑 어울리길 더 좋아하는 건 알지만...

translation.en: -[Shirley] Don't be so hard on yourself. -[Theo] I got beer.
I mean, she's sweet enough, but, pile of issues.
[Shirley] I don't think you can know much after such a quick encounter.
translation.ko: 그렇게 빨리 하고 헤어지면 어떤 사람인지 모를 것 같은데

translation.en: Who's saying it's quick? I'm a giver.
You're worse than a guy. You're like a frat guy.
translation.ko: 그냥 남자도 아니고 껄떡거리는 대학생 같아

translation.en: When I said you could live here, I wasn't expecting the pussy parade.
translation.ko: 여기 살게 해줬을 때는 여자가 맨날 바뀔 줄은 몰랐지

translation.en: -Yeah, 'cause it sucks to be Nell. -She call you?
translation.ko: - 그래, 걔 인생은 구리니까 - 너한테도 전화했어?

translation.en: No. Course not. We still haven't talked since LA.
translation.ko: 아니 할 리가 없지 LA 일 이후로 연락 안 해

translation.en: I'm just waiting for an apology.
I'm drawing boundaries, which is something you might want to look into.
translation.ko: 선을 긋는 거라고 언니는 그 선을 넘어다보고 싶을지도 모르지만

translation.en: One foot in crazy and the other on a banana peel.
She said it was about Luke.
I don't know, something about it... scared me.
Luke will show up... when he needs money.
Or if he does, it'll be the last time I ever see him.
Maybe a brick wall when it comes to Luke.
[stammering] Honey, are you okay? What time is it?
Do you remember the Bent-Neck Lady?
I want you to go to Steve and Leigh's.
I-- I'm-- I'm going to drive to Orlando and...
and get a flight to LA.
You-- Steve's closest. You go to him.
translation.ko: 스티브가 제일 가까우니까 스티브한테 가 있으렴

translation.en: Okay, now, I'll see-- I'll see you there tomorrow.
translation.ko: 알겠지, 그럼 내일 스티브 집에서 보자꾸나

translation.en: I-- I don't know. She-- she wouldn't--
-We gotta get out of here. -[Young Steve] Why?
-[Young Steve] Dad, what's going on? -[softly] Quiet.
You keep your eyes closed, no matter what you hear.
translation.ko: 무슨 소리가 들려도 눈 꼭 감아야 한다

translation.en: You keep your eyes closed, no matter what.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 눈 꼭 감고 있어

translation.en: I saw Abigail in the window!
[sobs] What's happening? What's happening? Where's Mom?
I-- I thought I saw her upstairs!
Dad, I told you, there's no reason you and I need to talk.
translation.ko: 아빠, 말씀드렸잖아요 아빠랑 제가 할 얘기는 없다고

translation.en: You don't just get to call me and tell me what to do.
You're closest, and your sister needs you.
translation.ko: 네가 제일 가깝고 네 동생은 네가 필요해

translation.en: You get home and you stay with her. You keep your eye on her.
translation.ko: 집에 가서 동생 곁에 있어줘 잘 지켜봐, 한눈팔지 말고

translation.en: -Don't let her out of your sight. -Dad, I'm not even--
translation.ko: 잘 지켜봐, 한눈팔지 말고 - 아빠, 전 지금... - 너희 집에서 보자

translation.en: I'll see you there. I'll meet you there.
translation.ko: - 아빠, 전 지금... - 너희 집에서 보자

translation.en: [Steve] Used to be a stop sign there until recently, yes?
There's a pole there, see? But no sign.
[Steve] Kids take 'em for their dorm rooms.
translation.ko: 기숙사 방에 걸려고 애들이 훔쳐 간 거예요

translation.en: A four-way stop without a sign is bound to have a few near misses.
You slept better with your husband in bed, right?
translation.ko: 남편분이 계실 때는 더 잘 주무셨죠?

translation.en: You're probably just noticing the car horns now
because you're not sleeping as well. Things you used to sleep through.
translation.ko: 잘 못 주무셔서 그럴 겁니다 예전엔 못 들으신 거죠

translation.en: There was a big storm the night he died.
translation.ko: 남편분 돌아가시던 밤에 큰 폭풍이 왔다고

translation.en: One of the biggest you've seen in a long time.
translation.ko: 손에 꼽을 만큼 큰 폭풍이라고 하셨죠

translation.en: [sighs] There's a leak in your roof.
You just didn't notice the water damage because of all the paneling.
translation.ko: 천장 마감재 때문에 알아채지 못하셨을 뿐이죠

translation.en: It was only drizzling last night, and I even got a few drips.
translation.ko: 겨우 보슬비가 왔는데도 어젯밤에 몇 방울 맞았어요

translation.en: You might wanna get that looked at. Water damage is no joke.
translation.ko: 살펴보시는 게 좋겠습니다 비가 새는 건 심각한 문제니까요

translation.en: And the man I saw hanging from my ceiling?
It is a powerful thing, ma'am.
The water and the car horns...
you'd be picturing how he died as much as you wouldn't want to.
translation.ko: 남편분 죽음이 안타까운 만큼 돌아가신 모습을 더 상상하셨겠죠

translation.en: -I saw him. -When you push that stuff down...
it comes out at night. You couldn't help it.
translation.ko: 밤이면 생각이 나죠 어쩔 수 없어요

translation.en: When I said I've never seen a ghost, that's not exactly true.
translation.ko: 유령을 본 적 없다고 한 건 사실이 아닙니다

translation.en: I've seen a lot of ghosts.
Just not the way you think.
A ghost can be a lot of things.
translation.ko: 유령은 많은 게 될 수 있어요

translation.en: A memory, a daydream, a secret.
most times, they're just what we want to see.
translation.ko: 대부분 우리가 보고 싶은 게 보일 뿐입니다

translation.en: Why would I want to see my Carl like that?
translation.ko: 내가 왜 내 남편 칼의 그런 모습을 보고 싶겠어요?

translation.en: Because it's better than never seeing him again.
Most times, a ghost is a wish.
-You didn't like it. -No, I didn't like it.
translation.ko: - 마음에 안 들었구나 - 그래, 마음에 안 들었어

translation.en: My brother just raped the family is what's going on.
translation.ko: 오빠가 지금 우리 가족을 엿먹여서 그래요

translation.en: Look, I get that things haven't exactly been going well with your writing
translation.ko: 오빠 글 쓰는 일이 잘 안 풀리는 건 알고

translation.en: and when you said you wanted to do a book about the house,
translation.ko: 그 집을 소재로 글 쓰고 싶다고 했을 때

translation.en: I understood that, but this is--
I sent you guys the manuscript in case you had any objections.
translation.ko: 혹시 너희가 반대할까 봐 원고를 보내준 거야

translation.en: -I-- I didn't have to do that. -Of course we object. I object, Steve!
translation.ko: 그럴 필요 없었는데 당연히 우린 반대하지 난 반대야, 오빠

translation.en: -Let's calm down a bit. -You be calm, Leigh.
It's not your name in here.
Nell, Luke, Theo, they were just kids.
Things they told you in confidence--
-I'm clear that they were kids. -You make Mom sound fucking crazy.
-Oh, Mom wasn't crazy? -[Shirley] And the Dudleys and Dad?
translation.ko: - 엄마가 안 미쳤니? - 더들리 부부랑 아빠 얘긴?

translation.en: This is the worst of the bullshit, worse than the tabloids.
translation.ko: 이 부분이 최악이야 그 찌라시들보다 더해

translation.en: Dad had every opportunity to set that straight.
[chuckles] What am I supposed to write? He said it was haunted.
translation.ko: 내가 뭘 써야 하는데? 유령 들린 집이라고 했어

translation.en: -Those are his words. -He was a wreck.
-He'd just lost his wife. -And he hasn't said shit since.
translation.ko: - 엄마를 잃은 직후였어 - 그때부터 한마디도 안 했지

translation.en: Does he talk to you, Shirl? Did he tell you what happened that night?
translation.ko: 아빠가 너한테 얘기했어? 그날 밤 무슨 일이 있었는지?

translation.en: Because all I've got are those tabloid quotes.
translation.ko: 내가 아는 건 그 찌라시들뿐이라서 말이야

translation.en: He refuses to tell us anything else.
When he said those things, he believed them.
translation.ko: 그런 얘기를 했을 때 아빠는 믿었다고

translation.en: In the moment, at least, and-- and you never did.
translation.ko: 적어도 그때는 믿었어 오빠는 믿은 적이 없지

translation.en: And now you're digging up that stuff? For a buck?
translation.ko: 이제 와서 그 얘길 끄집어내? 돈 몇 푼에?

translation.en: So you can stop living off credit for a change?
-"A buck"? -Look, I can tell that you're upset,
translation.ko: - 돈 몇 푼? - 저기, 흥분한 건 알겠는데

translation.en: Do you know how much money they're offering on the advance?
translation.ko: 출판사에서 주겠다는 돈이 얼마인 줄이나 알아?

translation.en: We can buy a house, we can move to LA. We can...
translation.ko: 우리 집도 살 수 있고 LA로 이사도 갈 수 있고, 또...

translation.en: I need to start a real life, for my own family.
translation.ko: 난 진짜 인생을 시작해야 해 내 가족을 위해서

translation.en: -What you're doing to Mom-- -Mom was mentally ill.
translation.ko: - 이러면 엄마한테... - 엄마는 마음의 병이 있었어

translation.en: I'll be damned if the apple didn't fall too far from...
Now you know what I think.
You publish this, you know what it costs.
translation.ko: 이거 책으로 내면 어떤 대가를 치를지 알지

translation.en: Did you know it was used as a hospice briefly in the '60s?
I'd like to talk to you some more about your marriage,
translation.ko: 결혼 생활에 관해서도 더 들어보고 싶어요

translation.en: and get some background on Carl. Who he was...
I'll need to take some liberties.
But I promise to be respectful.
I'll do it in a way he would have really liked.
translation.ko: 칼이 정말 좋아하실 만한 글을 쓰겠습니다

translation.en: -[father] They didn't see anything. -That's not the point.
translation.ko: 애들은 아무것도 못 봤어요 그게 중요한 게 아니잖아요

translation.en: My kids don't take the stand, Ross.
translation.ko: 우리 애들은 증언대에 못 세워요, 로스

translation.en: I had my eyes closed when we left.
translation.ko: 저는 집 떠날 때 눈을 감고 있었어요

translation.en: -No one can corroborate your story, Hugh. -That's right.
[man] The judge hears you talk about packing five kids into your car,
translation.ko: 새벽 3시에 아이 다섯을 차에 태웠다고 하는데

translation.en: they're gonna wonder why they aren't hearing from those kids.
translation.ko: 왜 아이들 증언은 없는지 재판부가 궁금해할 겁니다

translation.en: The media is already piling on.
If we don't give 'em someone else to write about,
it's gonna be more and more of this.

translation.ko: - 찌라시일 뿐이에요 - 가정 법원인데 "미친 크레인 유령 들린 집이라 주장"

translation.en: This type of stuff doesn't help in a custody hearing.
translation.ko: 이런 기사는 양육권 심리에 도움이 안 돼요

translation.en: [Younger Hugh] They never filed charges. I was never placed under arrest.
translation.ko: 기소도 안 했잖아요 전 체포 기록도 없고요

translation.en: They got this off your statement to the police!
I wasn't thinking clearly that night. We just lean on that.
translation.ko: 그날 밤은 제정신이 아니었다 그렇게 밀고 갑시다

translation.en: -We can't un-ring this bell. -Okay, fine, they can rip me to pieces,
translation.ko: 주워 담을 수는 없어요 좋아요, 난 물어뜯더라도

translation.en: but they don't get to take bites out of the kids.
[man] It'd just go a long way if you'd let the press near the house.
translation.ko: 언론을 그 집에 접근하게 해주면 꽤 도움이 될 겁니다

translation.en: They'll pay you to walk the grounds, take some pictures.
translation.ko: 집 근처 걸으며 사진 찍게 해주면 당신한테 돈을 낼 거라고요

translation.en: No one goes near the house.
translation.ko: 아무도 그 집 근처엔 못 옵니다

translation.en: Then sell it. You need the money, Hugh.
translation.ko: 그럼 집을 파세요 돈이 필요하잖아요, 휴

translation.en: You're saying you wanna keep the house your wife just died in?
translation.ko: 부인이 막 죽은 집을 갖고 있겠다는 겁니까?

translation.en: You have any idea how that looks?
and the doors kept locked at all times,
and I wanna know every day that it's empty.
translation.ko: 그리고 매일 비어 있는지 확인할 거예요

translation.en: The Dudleys stay on, and it sits there and rots.
translation.ko: 더들리 부부는 남을 겁니다 그리고 그 집은 그대로 썩을 거고요

translation.en: I'm sorry you had to hear that.
Do we really have to go live with Aunt Janet?
-She may show up at the house today. -[Leigh] At my house?
translation.ko: 오늘 집에 갈지도 몰라 내 집에?

translation.en: My dad told her to. I didn't get a chance to tell him, it's...
translation.ko: 우리 아빠가 보냈거든 아빠한테 말할 틈이 없었어

translation.en: But I'm sorry. You can just point her to me.
translation.ko: 그래도 미안해 그냥 나 있는 데로 보내

translation.en: Maybe... I can come by, and we can talk about this some more.
translation.ko: 내가 잠깐 들러서 같이 얘기 좀 더 해도 되고

translation.en: You know what you'd have to say. You tell me.
translation.ko: 무슨 말을 해야 할지는 당신이 알잖아, 알아서 해

translation.en: Arranging the china and some of the flatware,
translation.ko: 은 식기 조금이랑 도자기를 정리하고 있단다

translation.en: so that your father can sell them.
Dad says you and Mr. Dudley come with the house.
translation.ko: 아빠가 아저씨랑 아주머니는 이 집과 뗄 수 없대요

translation.en: Houses like this one require a staff.
At the edge of the property, through the woods,
translation.ko: 이 집 땅 변두리에 있는 숲속에 살지

translation.en: But there are so many rooms.
The staff hasn't lived on the grounds since 1948.
translation.ko: 1948년 이후로 관리인은 이 집에 안 살았어

translation.en: So the people that lived here before us...
translation.ko: 그럼 저희 전에 이 집에 살았던 사람들은...

translation.en: No one would live nearer than town.
translation.ko: 아무도 마을보다 더는 이 집 가까이 살지 않았단다

translation.en: No one will come any nearer than that.
translation.ko: 아무도 그보다 더 가까이 오지 않을 거야

translation.en: Well, they didn't seem to be too scared.
My dad found a bunch of stuff in the parlor.
Tarot cards and Ouija boards and all that.
translation.ko: 타로 카드랑 위저 보드랑 그런 것들요

translation.en: So, something tells me they weren't too scared of the dark.
translation.ko: 그러니까 어둠을 그렇게 무서워하진 않은 것 같네요

translation.en: And you know what those things do, don't you?
They're parlor games. People use them to scare themselves.
translation.ko: 게임이잖아요 손님들 겁줄 때 쓰는 게임

translation.en: This is the problem with schools these days.
They teach you the secular world,
And science isn't an exact science, you know.
The world is dark, young man,
and the only light is the light of the Lord Jesus Christ.
translation.ko: 그리고 유일한 빛은 주 예수 그리스도의 빛이지

translation.en: We need his light in the night.
Do you know the Gospels, young man?
Hugh and I decided when Steve was little.
translation.ko: 스티브가 어렸을 때 저희가 정한 교육 방침이죠

translation.en: See, we knew that throughout his life he'd be exposed
to all sorts of ideas and beliefs.
translation.ko: 온갖 생각과 믿음에 노출되리란 걸 아니까요

translation.en: That there'd be all sorts of people who'd tell him they had the answers.
translation.ko: 온갖 사람이 자기들한테 답이 있다고 말할 것도 알고요

translation.en: I'm sorry, I meant no offense.
[chuckles] So yes, he knows the Gospels.
He's also familiar with the Talmud.
The Tao Te Ching, the Torah, the Koran, Greek mythology.
And he reads a lot of Carl Sagan, Shakespeare.
translation.ko: 그리고 칼 세이건이랑 셰익스피어도 많이 읽어요

translation.en: "Because there are more things in Heaven and Earth, Horatio..."
translation.ko: '소위 그 철학에서는 꿈도 꾸지 못할 별별 일이' '호레이쇼여...'

translation.en: "...than are dreamt of in your philosophy."
Well, I don't suppose either of you have seen Luke.
translation.ko: 둘 다 루크는 못 봤나 봐요

translation.en: I assume you tried the tree house?
It never occurs to her you'll be in your tree house. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 네가 나무집에 있을 거라곤 생각도 못 하나 봐

translation.en: You know, the one Dad built for you?
I don't wanna go in yet.
How do you spell "no girls allowed"?
I told you last time, that's a bad idea.
-What happened to your other sign? -[Young Luke] Theo ripped it.
translation.ko: 다른 표지판은 어쨌어? 테오 누나가 찢어버렸어

translation.en: [Young Luke] Some girl I saw by the woods.
You know, I used to have imaginary friends, too.
translation.ko: 있잖아, 형도 예전에는 상상 친구가 있었어

translation.en: They go away when you get bigger.
Theo can't rip this one. It's not allowed.
translation.ko: 이건 테오 누나가 못 찢어 금지니까

translation.en: Will you hang out with me?
You can hang out all the time.
Where do you get the ideas for these drawings?
Well, uh, this isn't what it looks like. Um...
How'd you know where to find me?
you can keep the cash and sell that old camera.
translation.ko: 여기 200달러 받고 그 낡은 카메라는 팔아도 돼

translation.en: You know, it really isn't what you think.
I tried to tell Dad we're... [sighs] ...we're having some issues,
translation.ko: 나랑 리랑 문제가 좀 있다고 아빠한테 얘기를...

translation.en: Did you tell Luke where I live?
You just stood there and watched him loot me?
translation.ko: 거기 가만히 서서 내 물건 훔치는 꼴 지켜봤어?

translation.en: So you hit up everybody, dragged Luke out,
translation.ko: 온 가족 들들 볶아서 루크 나타나게 하고 아빠 비행기 타게 하고

translation.en: made Dad hop on a plane.
translation.ko: 루크 나타나게 하고 아빠 비행기 타게 하고

translation.en: You got us all listening. What do you want?
translation.ko: 우리는 다 준비됐어 무슨 말이 하고 싶니?

translation.en: Shit, I didn't give him the address.
Hey, I tried to tell you, we're--
translation.ko: 네, 말씀드리려고 했는데 제가 요즘 리랑...

translation.en: You hear me? I said it's about Nell.
-I know, I just walked in, and she's-- -Nell was lying.
translation.ko: - 네, 방금 집에 왔더니... - 넬이 거짓말을 했어

translation.en: She wasn't in LA. She was at the house, Steve.
translation.ko: LA에 있는 게 아니었어 넬이 그 집에 있었다, 스티브
